title: 10¢ Finally showing their greedy nature
body:
Today was announced that RP price is going up on all serves except the Chinese, the American and the Korean.
EUNE +10%
EUW +10%
CANADA +13%
OCE +13%

My concern is that this will reflect badly on Riot's profit and will result in worsened service from their side.


https://cdn.evbuc.com/eventlogos/23719188/tencentgame.png
Tnx 10¢ !

replies.body: Don't get me wrong... I'm Canadian... and I hate price increases... but it's not greedy to alter prices when the value of the dollar changes. Canadians have been dealing with that with the price of EVERYTHING forever. Videogames went up by 10 bucks about a year and a half ago across the board(with a few exceptions), for example. Books typically cost 10-30% more up here... when the dollar gets close to even, stores start advertising that you can pay the USD price on the cover... this is nothing new, nor is it exclusive to Riot/Tencent.

i only see as greedy because its not gonna trickle down to their employees that need it, they will still be getting paid the same despite their wages being worth less and the consumers wont be earning more either. It's just a money grab, 'money is worth less so now you have to pay me a larger cut.'

i suspect they will lose market saturation without recouping the losses in the future.

There are also exchange rates that have to be taken into account though. For them to ensure that the 'ideal method' of buying RP isn't for an American player to come to Canada and buy here, they have to ensure the cost is comparable given that being the case. Because if the ideal method is that then THEY as a company lose money on the exchange rate...

It's also bad for business if you, as a company, are actively encouraging your largest market to go somewhere else to buy your goods because they're getting a significantly better price.(which is what would be the case if they hadn't altered the prices). 

I don't LIKE that these things are factors that have to be taken into account... but I recognize that they are. It sucks for us Canadians(and for the Europeans too)

They're raising prices in other countries so that the value of RP is comparable across all regions; it doesn't have a whole lot to do with anything trickling down. Technically speaking, since the values of these other countries' currencies have started shifting in this direction, Riot's just been making less money than they were supposed to. They don't have any particular reason, ethical or otherwise, to "compensate" employees for this, but even regardless of that, it's not like they aren't just because they haven't told us they are.
It would be really cool if digital places like Steam had fluctuating prices based on the actual dollar value rather than just making everything cost a flat amount more and not changing it.
